column4: I'm sorry to go on about this but has anyone got any ideas on why the resolution isn't working. It's just that I am looking to move to a linux OS permanently but I want to try using it on my windows system first and I really can't use it properly if I only have a small window sized display
what is the output of:   lspci | grep -i vga
its a command line command, run i in terminal
It says: 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: InnoTek Systemberatung GmbH VirtualBox Graphics Adapter
ok, so its a virtualbox
have youinstalled the guest additions?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=777759
edit your xorg.conf and make the display sections similar
actually i'd just use the whole thing
your keyboard may be different (that example uses US layout, you can omit that line)
you will need    gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    to edit ti
if you tab complete my name its easier, and it will highlight your text
you will learn
you need to get that text file as it is in the link i gave, then reboot. As long as you have the guest additions installed correctly then it will be fine
you needed to execute the .run file on the guest additions CD for your architecture
I did the run for the additions and I have got the text file and I'm just gonna reboot see if that sorts it. Thank you and I will be back to et you know if I am up and running or not

Nope, still no joy. To be honest, I'm feeling a bit crap because I feel like I'm bugging people, I feel like I should know the basics before I start asking for help but I can't start learning the basic until I can actually use my full screen.
its all learning dude, dont sweat it
maybe someone in #vbox can help
as you use the OS you will get better at it
just like i'm sure you are with microsoft products
as is ask.com  msn.com  yahoo.com
